place.name: CARLETON RODE
place.gazetteerText: CARLTON-RODE, a parish in Depwade district, Norfolk; 2 miles NE of New Buckenham, and 4 ESE of Attleborough r. station. Post Town, New Buckenham, under Attleborough. Acres, 2,631. Real property, £5,823. Pop., 905. Houses, 203. The property is much subdivided. an ancient rood or cross gave rise to the suffix Rode. The living is a rectory in the diocese of Norwich. Value, £850.* Patron, Sir R. J. Buxton, Bart. The church is good; and there are a Baptist chapel, a national school, and charities £68. (In 1870-72, John Marius Wilson's Imperial Gazetteer of England and Wales)
